item.title: CNFF Opposes the SANDAG Ballot Measure
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: For Immediate Release July 5, 2016 Contact Jana Clark, (619) 659-8962 Jack Shu, (619) 460-9215 Duncan McFetridge, (619) 659-8962 Cleveland National Forest Foundation The so-called transit improvements in the proposed SANDAG tax measure for the November ballot are propaganda. Frantic Last minute deal making wastes 7 billion in tax dollars for transit improvements that don’t even add up […]

item.title: San Diego’s Transportation Future
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: The federal economic stimulus package presents San Diego with an unprecedented opportunity to build much-needed infrastructure for the community. For example, just when we thought that enhancing public transit in our region was impossible, federal funds may soon be available. Yet, rather than use this opportunity to address this vital gap in our transportation system, the San Diego Association of Governments is considering spending the vast majority of federal funds (which could be as high as $10 billion) on new highway projects...
